full_text:
BE PREPARED FOR AN
EARTHQUAKE
Earthquakes can collapse
buildings and cause heavy
items to fall, resulting in
injuries and property damage.
FEMA V-1003/May 2018
Earthquakes are the
sudden, rapid shaking of
the earth, caused by the
breaking and shifting of
underground rock. Can happen anywhere. Higher Give no Cause fires and Cause tsunamis,
risk areas are California, Alaska, warning damage roads landslides, and
and the Mississippi Valley avalanches
IF AN EARTHQUAKE HAPPENS,
PROTECT YOURSELF RIGHT AWAY
If in a vehicle, If in bed, If outdoors, Do not get in Do not run
pull over and stop. stay there. stay outdoors. a doorway. outside.


HOW TO STAY SAFE
WHEN AN EARTHQUAKE THREATENS
Prepare Survive Be Safe
NOW DURING AFTER
Secure items such as televisions and Drop, Cover, and Hold On like you Expect aftershocks to follow the
objects that hang on walls. Store practiced. Drop to your hands and largest shock of an earthquake
heavy and breakable objects on low knees. Cover your head and neck sequence.
shelves. with your arms. Hold on to any
sturdy furniture until the shaking Check yourself for injury.
Practice Drop, Cover, and Hold On stops. Crawl only if you can reach
with family and coworkers. Drop to better cover without going through If in a damaged building, go
your hands and knees. Cover your an area with more debris. outside and quickly move away
head and neck with your arms. Crawl from the building.
only as far as needed to reach cover If in bed, stay there and cover your
Do not enter damaged buildings.
from falling materials. Hold on to head and neck with a pillow.
any sturdy furniture until the shaking
If you are trapped, send a text or
stops. If inside, stay there until the shaking
bang on a pipe or wall. Cover your
stops. DO NOT run outside.
mouth for protection and instead of
Create a family emergency
communication plan that has an If in a vehicle, stop in a clear shouting, use a whistle.
out-of-state contact. Plan where to area that is away from buildings,
If you are in an area that may
meet if you get separated. trees, overpasses, underpasses, or
experience tsunamis, go inland or to
utility wires.
higher ground immediately after the
Make a supply kit that includes
enough food and water for several If you are in a high-rise building, shaking stops.
days, a flashlight, a fire extinguisher, expect fire alarms and sprinklers to
Save phone calls for emergencies.
and a whistle. Consider each person’s go off. Do not use elevators.
specific needs, including medication.
Wear sturdy shoes and work gloves.
If near slopes, cliffs, or mountains,
Do not forget the needs of pets.
be alert for falling rocks and
Have extra batteries and charging
landslides.
devices for phones and other critical
equipment.
Consider earthquake insurance
policies. Standard homeowner’s
Take an Active
insurance does not cover
Role in Your Safety
earthquake damage.
Go to Ready.gov/
Consider a retrofit of your building
if it has structural issues that make earthquakes. Download
it vulnerable to collapse during the FEMA app to get
an earthquake. more information
about preparing for an
earthquake.
FEMA V-1003
